author: Ebere Benny
comment: I think it should undergo real development.  I shared with my contact and it shares the word 'false' to everyone. Damn

author: glyko
comment: Can't create an account due to a server error :/

author: Ixolex Credo
comment: Want to use this but the UI Incomplete </3

author: Denis Buslaev
comment: Installed. Met a bug. Deleted.

author: Ime Prezime
comment: Can not save anything ... discard changes and quit? ... and now has "stopped" ... ZERO not one star ... ZERO confirmed ... DOESN'T save ... still can NOT save ... top bar does NOT work ... still MINUS not zero

author: Teodora C
comment: Why did you change the status bar drawing method?? Now it's always black with a weird overlayed black thingy over the colored header when scrolling.
title: Glitches

author: sachin tripathi
comment: Not able to save notes and other option showing top bar.

author: Cynthia Valdez
comment: I still do not have the ability to drag and drop notes in the order that I want which is annoying.  Every other productivity app in the market has this feature, I don't know why Centrallo doesn't. Still no recurring reminders although you can add more then one reminder to a note which is nice. It would also be nice to have the option to sort lists by color so I can see the priority items marked on the top of a list. And what the heck is the radar feature for? Other then that, Centrallo works great.

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Thank you for the feedback! We always try to do our best!

title: Almost there, but not quite

author: Василий Коробкин
comment: If you want to organize your life - this is the best choice. Comfortable UI, rich functional, robust storage - I love it. How could I live without this app?
title: I cannot stop using it

author: Nelsha Athauda
comment: After the update it hasn't been working anymore on my Samsung Galaxy Note 3. Part of the top isn't showing anymore so I can't save my notes after I make them making the whole app unusable
title: Used to work great

author: Nadine Camille Ochoa
comment: On a search for Evernote replacement so I tried this after a number of recommendations. It's good, but web app seem to be laggish and the trash won't let me empty it. Though it works perfectly well in mobile. I just feel a bit limited with 100 notes but I'll still think about this.
title: Okay

author: Jimmy Lee
comment: This apps is totally not ready. Lot's of error.
title: Not good

author: Michael Anderson
comment: Sharing is clunky and and only possible by providing others with your email address; instead, users should be able to share with other users via usernames, and there should be a way to move items shared with me from the Inbox to my Lists. Dev response to questions and requests for help is woefully slow, especially since there is no Help section within the app that helps explain specific functions. I'm excited to see how this app progresses, and I'll revisit this review as changes are introduced to the app.
title: A good start to an app that still feels like it's in beta.

author: Bozhnev Mikhail
comment: Beautiful and very easy! Thank you!
title: Love it

author: Андрей Тищенко
comment: Not bad app. But limit on free notes...

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Thank you for your feedback. Feel free to invite your friends and get +50 notes per each registration. Or import your Notes from Evernote & get 3 month free premium. If you have any other ideas — please let us know support@centrallo.com.

title: Not bad

author: Naiyer Asif
comment: Would love a dark theme, some basic rich formatting and a grid (and, if possible, masonry) view.

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Thank you for your feedback. Rich text formatting is already in plans, so it will be delivered soon. About the grid: we are not sure atm, but we might consider it. Please send us your ideas to support@centrallo.com. Thank you in advance!

title: Seems promising

author: Lena Ghannam
comment: The thing that I need the most (list function) doesn't work at all. There is no way to actually add anything to/edit a list when you select the new list option. I want to love this app but without ease of use and functional lists, I can't really trust it with my stuff :( it's more of a hassle than a help

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Sorry for the issues you have. Could you please send us the details to support@centrallo.com (including the model of your device + version of Android) + some screenshots. We will fix ASAP the issues you have. Again, sorry.

title: So frustrating

author: André Bonhôte
comment: Had to sign up twice. The web gui doesn't save...

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Sorry for the issue. Could you please provide more information what you've tried to do to support@centrallo.com. We will fix it ASAP.

title: Doesn't really work.

author: Rafael Xavier
comment: Centrallo missed two reminders that had been set for the next day.

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Sorry for the issue. Could you please send us the information about the device that was used (model, vendor): support@centrallo.com. Also please make sure that you've chosen the proper calendar in Settings where the reminders should be added.

title: Reminders are not working

author: Mihai Just Mihai
comment: Nice utility

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Thank you!

author: michele creanza
comment: Great organization tool.  Helps me keep lists and prioritize them.

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Thank you! If you have any ideas — please let us know: support@centrallo.com!

title: Great organization tool

author: Kenneth Schepps
comment: App crashes every time I try to add a note. Please fix ASAP.

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Sorry about the issue. We've improved the app. Do you still have the issue? If yes — please send us the information to support@centrallo.com and we will fix ASAP.

title: Trying to get back into using Centrallo

author: Mike Stevens
comment: There's finally a widget, although it's a little underwhelming. Latest update is good, although there's a number of irritating bugs that oncr again stop me using the app more extensively.

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Hey Mike! Sorry about that. We've just released Material design version. Widget will be in next version.  Weeks away!  We hope you will change your mind & rate us 5 after that :)

author: Sudden Ven
comment: Is it possible to selectively sync notes? Some of the notes are taking up a large proportion of space on my phone.

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Unfortunately — not for now. But we will think about a special place in Centrallo where you can store Notes locally! Thank you for the suggestion!

title: Selective sync?

author: Lurenzia Robinson
comment: Sync not working, uninstalling

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Sorry for this issue. Could you please send a report from your Settings area in Centrallo, so we would be able to fix the issue? If you have experienced any other issues — please e-mail them to support@centrallo.com.  Thank you.

author: Dennis Sugono
comment: Thanks for listening to our plea for more storage 15gb thats awesome. one question though about the updated app: how to restore from archive?

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Upd: to see archived notes tap filter button in the top & choose "show archive". To restore — find the note, go inside & tap "Restore" button in the top.

title: great concept

author: Bradley Wyatt
comment: Keep updating I'm liking it

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Thank you! If you have any suggestions on how to make Centrallo better, please send them to us: support@centrallo.com

title: May get me to leave todoist

author: Vlada Stojanovic
comment: Great.

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Thank you!

author: Abdalla A
comment: Trello, Evernote and Keep should keep an eye on this promising App. amazing, simple, functional, productive,

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Thank you! If you have any suggestions — please write us support@centrallo.com

title: Perfect

author: Nihar Prajapati
comment: better than evernote, diaro, better diary

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Thank you very much! Yeah, we definitely feel the same way! If you have any suggestions — just let us know: support@centrallo.com

title: 👍 great app

author: Philip Malcolm
comment: After my initial reported problems they have now been fixed with a new update, Centrallo also added a lot of new and improved features.  Now I'm very happy to give this app a 4 star rating.  Keep up the good work Centrallo :)

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Let us know what we can do to make us worthy of 5 stars!

author: Brian Hageman
comment: It doesn't a fraction of the functionality of Evernote. I assume that reviewers claiming that are shills. It might grow to be a useful app but it isn't now. Uninstalled.

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Brian.  Many people think this way.  Our core differentiator is the ability to make lists within lists and organize your notes. Also sharing, publishing, ability to share notes in already shared list (you can't do this in Dropbox). If you have any ideas or suggestions — please write us support@centrallo.com!

title: Evernote killer? Not a chance.

author: Novel & Knit a.k.a. Emily Jean
comment: It all started with a low star review because of an issue that I was having. Then I got an email from the developer asking to change my rating because the issue was fixed. I emailed him back stating that I was still having the same problem and that I can't change my low review. NOW I'm getting email after email with questions. The latest one was just this morning. I'm starting to feel real  unconfortable about all these emails. 4 - 3: UNINSTALLING! Due to the above & more bug issues. Sticking w Google Keep

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Hey Emily! We are very sorry to hear that. Could you please send your request directly to support@centrallo.com. We will also grant you Premium account for 1 year and we are REALLY sorry about that.

title: Stalking??

author: St Skill
comment: I find it useful to organize data from all sources into useful lists...

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Thank you!

title: Try it you will be surprised

author: jason hairford
comment: Confusing and cumbersome. Tried to use but found it was more work than really worth it.

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Mi smo zelo žal za to. Preizkusite novo različico z materialno obliko. Pravkar smo sproščeni to različico.

title: Meh

author: Hans Pietersen
comment: I want to use the app as it seems VERY promising, but it hangs, freezes and aborts unexpectedly on my Note 3. I'll wait for next update.

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Hey Hans! We are really sorry to hear that. In the meantime we've just released the new version of Centrallo with new, material design. So you won't have issues anymore. Please write us to support@centrallo.com and we will grant you 1 year premium account!

title: Frustrating...

author: Steven Rodriguez
comment: Is a material design update in the works?

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Just released. Feel free to check! Thank you for your patience!

title: Almost There

author: Dave Stern
comment: But widget keeps going blank? (nova launcher on kit Kat 4.4.4 note 3). It did have data then was blank, then had data, now is blank. Was syncing with server for about a day this weekend (?). Finished syncing today. Would like to try it out when widget is working again. Also wear support will be good!
title: Great concept

author: Matthew Buschur
comment: Love this app really like the way the items stack into folders and lists. I've always wanted to get in the habit of using note taking apps, but never found one that I actually use... Until now.  My only problem with it is that I wish it had android wear support. If they update it with wear support I'll give it 5 stars.

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Matthew.  Android Wear support is coming.  Will keep you posted.  Glad you like the app so far.

title: Great note taking app, one issue

author: Aaron
comment: There's no way of actually viewing a whole list. You can only see one item in the list at a time.  This is so weird. Its not simple or straight forward at all.  It looks like something from the first android phone ever made and is very dark looking.

reply.author: Centrallo
reply.content: Hey! At first of all you can switch the background from dark to light in Settings area. At second: you are able to view multiple items in the list (e.g. 30, 40, 50). If you don't see them please send us the screenshots, the description and the Android version to support@centrallo.com. Sorry for the issue, we will do our best in order to help you.

title: Not good
